t.t: LGL123 climb  FL310.
LGL123 descend  FL310.

3.s: CLIMB [or DESCEND] To Reach (FL) AT (Time or significant point)

t.t: LGL123 descend to reach FL210 at ELLEN
LGL123 report leaving FL310.

5.s: CLIMB [or DESCEND]  AND MAINTAIN BLOCK (level) TO (level).

t.t: SVF123 descend  and maintain block FL270 to FL300.

6.s: AT (number) METRES PER SECOND (or FEET PER MINUTE) [OR GREATER (or OR LESS)].

t.t: LGL123 climb at two thousand feet per minute or less.

7.s: REQUEST LEVEL (or FLIGHT LEVEL or ALTITUDE) CHANGE FROM (name of unit) [AT (time or significant point)].

t.t: LGL123 request flight level change from Tampere control at RUNUS.
LGL123 stop climb at FL310.
LGL123 continue climb  FL310
LGL123 when ready descend FL310.

12.s: EXPECT CLIMB (or DESCENT) AT (time or significant point).

t.t: LGL123 expect climb at time four five.
Request descent at time four five, LGL123.
LGL123, after passing BURMA, climb  FL320.
LGL123, if unable maintain FL310 and advise.
Unable, LGL123.<br />

19.u: After a flight crew starts to deviate from any ATC clearance or instruction to comply with an ACAS resolution advisory (RA) (Controller answers ROGER)

t.t: LGL123 TCAS RA.

20.s: CLEAR OF CONFLICT, RETURNING TO (assigned clearance).
20.u: After a flight crew starts to deviate from any ATC clearance or instruction to comply with an ACAS resolution advisory (RA) (Controller answers ROGER)

t.t: LGL123 clear of conflict, returning to FL330.

21.u: After a flight crew starts to deviate from any ATC clearance or instruction to comply with an ACAS resolution advisory (RA) (Controller answers ROGER)

t.t: LGL123 clear of conflict, FL330 resumed.<br />

22.u: After an ATC clearance or instruction contradictory to the ACAS RA is received, the flight crew will follow the RA and inform ATC directly (Controller answers ROGER)

t.t: LGL123 unable, TCAS RA.<br />

23.s: CLIMB  (level) [LEVEL RESTRICTION(S) (SID designator) CANCELLED (or) LEVEL RESTRICTION(S) (SID designator) AT (point) CANCELLED].
23.u:
Clearance to cancel level restriction(s) of the vertical
profile of a SID during climb

t.t: LGL123 climb  three thousand feet, level restrictions Alpha 1 departure cancelled.

24.s: DESCEND  (level) [LEVEL RESTRICTION(S) (STAR designator) CANCELLED (or) LEVEL RESTRICTION(S) (STAR designator) AT (point) CANCELLED].
24.u:
Clearance to cancel level restriction(s) of the vertical
profile of a STAR during descent

t.t: LGL123 descend  five thousand feet, QNH 1012 CURMI 1 alpha departure cancelled.

25.u:
Transfer of control and or frequency change.
The word NOW may be added to give emphasis.

t.t: LGL123 contact Tampere control one two four decimal one five.

26.s: AT (or OVER) (time or place) [or WHEN] [PASSING/LEAVING/REACHING (level)] CONTACT (unit call sign) (frequency).

t.t: LGL123 when passing FL250 contact Tampere control one two four decimal one five.
LGL123 if no contact remain on this frequency.

28.u:
An aircraft may be requested to “STAND BY” on a
frequency when it is intended that the ATS unit will initiate communications soon and to “MONITOR” a frequency when information is being broadcast thereon.

t.t: LGL123 stand by for Tampere control one one eight decimal zero zero five.

29.u:
An aircraft may be requested to “STAND BY” on a
frequency when it is intended that the ATS unit will initiate communications soon and to “MONITOR” a frequency when information is being broadcast
thereon. Pilot responds: Monitoring (frequency)

t.t: LGL123 monitor Tampere control one two four decimal one five.

30.u: Controller responds: FREQUENCY CHANGE APPROVED / DENIED

t.t: LGL123 request change to one two four decimal one five<br />.
LGL123 remain this frequency.

33.u:
To request confirmation of
8.33 kHz capability.
The pilot answers: AFFIRM [or NEGATIVE] EIGHT POINT THREE THREE.
Note: the term “point” is used only in the context of naming the 8.33 kHz channel spacing concept and does not constitute any change to existing ICAO provisions or phraseology regarding the use of the term “decimal”.

t.t: LGL 123 confirm eight point three three.

34.u: To request UHF capability. The pilot answers: AFFIRM [or NEGATIVE] UHF

t.t: MAF123 confirm UHF.

35.s: CONFIRM EIGHT POINT THREE THREE EXEMPTED
35.u:
To request status in respect of 8.33 kHz exemption
The pilot answers: AFFIRM [or NEGATIVE] EIGHT POINT THREE THREE EXEMPTED

t.t: MAF123 confirm eight point three three exempted.

36.s: DUE EIGHT POINT THREE THREE REQUIREMENT
36.u: To indicate that a certain clearance is given because otherwise a non-equipped and/or non-exempted aircraft would enter airspace of mandatory carriage

t.t: LGL123 due eight point three three descend to reach FL270 by BURKA.

37.s: CHANGE YOUR CALL SIGN TO (new call sign) [UNTIL FURTHER ADVISED].
37.u: To instruct an aircraft to change its type of call sign

t.t: LGL123 change your call sign to Lima Xray Victor Mike Alpha until further advised.

38.s: REVERT TO FLIGHT PLAN CALL SIGN (call sign) [AT (significant point)].
38.u: To advise an aircraft to revert to the call sign indicated in the flight plan

t.t: Lima Xray Victor Mike Alpha revert to flight plan call  sign LGL123 at SKILO.

39.s: TRAFFIC IS (classification) UNMANNED FREE BALLOON(S) WAS [or ESTIMATED] OVER (place) AT (time) REPORTED (level(s)) [or LEVEL  UNKNOWN] MOVING (direction) (other pertinent information, if any).
39.u:
To pass traffic information
Answered by Pilot: TRAFFIC IN SIGHT. or NEGATIVE CONTACT [reasons]

t.t: LGL123 traffic a Saab three four zero passed Skiro time one two flight level one eight zero estimate Horn time two one.

40.s: [ADDITIONAL] TRAFFIC (direction) BOUND (type of aircraft) (level) ESTIMATED (or OVER) (significant point) AT (time).
40.u:
to pass traffic information
Answered by Pilot: TRAFFIC IN SIGHT, or NEGATIVE CONTACT [reasons]

t.t: LGL123 additional traffic north bound ATR four two at flight level two two zero over SKI at time four five.
LGL123 no reported traffic.

43.s: WIND AT (level) (number) DEGREES (number) KILOMETRES PER HOUR (or KNOTS).
43.u:
Note.— Wind is always expressed by giving the mean
direction and speed and any significant variations thereof.
All numbers, except those used in the transmission of
altitude, cloud height, visibility and runway visual range (RVR) information, which contai

t.t: Wind at FL350, one zero zero degrees two niner knots.
Visibility eight kilometres
Runway visual range runway zero niner six hundred metres.

46.s:
RUNWAY VISUAL RANGE (or RVR) RUNWAY (number)
NOT AVAILABLE (or NOT REPORTED).

t.t: RVR runway zero niner not reported.

47.s: RUNWAY VISUAL RANGE (or RVR) [RUNWAY (number)] (first position) (distance) (units), (second position) (distance) (units), (third position) (distance) (units).
47.u:
Used for multiple RVR observations
Note 1.— Multiple RVR observations are always representative of the touchdown zone, midpoint zone and the roll-out/stop end zone, respectively.
Note 2.— Where reports for three locations are given, the indication of these locations may be omitted, provided that the reports are passed in the order of touchdown zone, followed by the midpoint zone and ending with the roll-out/stop end zone report.
All numbers, except those used in the transmission of altitude, cloud height, visibility and runway visual range (RVR) information, which contain whole hundreds and whole thousands, shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of hundreds or thousands followed by the word HUNDRED or THOUSAND as appropriate. Combinations of thousands and whole hundreds shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of thousands followed by the word THOUSAND followed by the number of hundreds followed by the word HUNDRED.

t.t: Runway visual range runway zero niner, touchdown six hundred metres, midpoint five four zero metres, stop end five four zero metres.<br />

48.s: RUNWAY VISUAL RANGE (or RVR) [RUNWAY (number)] (first position) (distance) (units), (second position) NOT AVAILABLE, (third position) (distance) (units).
48.u:
Multiple RVR observations are always representative of the touchdown zone, midpoint zone and the roll-out/stop end zone respectively.
Where reports for the three locations are given, the indication of these locations may be omitted, provided that the reports are passed in order of touchdown zone, followed by midpoint zone and ending with the roll-out/stop end zone report. In the event that RVR information on any one position is not available this information will be included in the appropriate sequence.
All numbers, except those used in the transmission of altitude, cloud height, visibility and runway visual range (RVR) information, which contain whole hundreds and whole thousands, shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of hundreds or thousands followed by the word HUNDRED or THOUSAND as appropriate. Combinations ofthousands and whole hundreds shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of thousands followed by the word THOUSAND followed by the number of hundreds followed by the word HUNDRED.

t.t: RVR runway zero niner, touchdown six hundred metres, midpoint not available, stop end five four zero metres.<br />

49.u:
The details are: mean surface wind direction and speed and significant variations there from:

b) visibility, including significant directional variations.
c) runway visual range (RVR).
d) present weather.
e) amount and height of base of low cloud.
f) air temperature and dew-point temperature.
g) altimeter setting(s). and
h) supplementary information.
Note.— Information on surface wind direction provided to ATS units by the associated meteorological office is referenced to degrees true North. Information on surface wind direction obtained from the ATS surface wind indicator and passed to pilots by ATS units is given in degrees magnetic.

t.t: Present weather, rain.

50.s: CLOUD (amount, [(type)] and height of base) (units) (or SKY CLEAR).
50.u: Sky clear Means no clouds and no restriction on vertical visibility.

t.t: Cloud scattered five thousand feet.

51.u: CAVOK Means no restriction on vertical visibility, no clouds below 5000 ft and no CB.

t.t: CAVOK.
Temperature minus two dew-point minus two.
QNH one zero one two.
QFE niner niner five.
Boeing seven three seven reported moderate turbulence at FL340.
LGL123 report flight conditions.<br />

To request a report at a specified place or distance

63.s: REPORT (GNSS or DME) DISTANCE FROM (significant point) or (name of DME station).

To ascertain RVSM approval status of an aircraft

82.s: UNABLE ISSUE CLEARANCE INTO RVSM AIRSPACE, MAINTAIN [or DESCEND , or CLIMB ] (level).

To request confirmation that an aircraft has regained RVSM approved status or a pilot is ready to resume RVSM operations
Pilot answers READY TO RESUME RVSM or NOT READY TO RESUME RVSM

t.t: LGL123 confirm able to resume RVSM.<br />

91.s: UNABLE RNP (specify type) (or RNAV) [DUE TO (reason, e.g. LOSS OF RAIM or RAIM ALERT)].

t.t: LGL123 unable RNAV due to equipment.

92.u:
Clearances shall contain the following in the order listed:
a) aircraft identification.
b) clearance limit.
c) route of flight.
d) level(s) of flight for the entire route or part thereof and changes of levels if required.
Note.— If the clearance for the levels covers only part of the route, it is important for the air traffic control unit to specify a point to which the part of the clearance regarding levels applies whenever necessary to ensure compliance with 3.6.5.2.2 a) of Annex 2.
e) any necessary instructions or information on other matters such as SSR transponder operation, approach or departure manoeuvres, communications and the time of expiry of the clearance.
Note.— The time of expiry of the clearance indicates the time after which the clearance will be automatically cancelled if the flight has not been started.

t.t: Luxo Tower clears LGL123 to Malaga via Holly upper Tango two one five, flight planned route FL320.

93.u:
Clearances shall contain the following in the order listed:
a) aircraft identification.
b) clearance limit.
c) route of flight.
d) level(s) of flight for the entire route or part thereof and changes of levels if required.
Note.— If the clearance for the l

343.u: Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

344.u:
When passing unknown traffic
applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

345.s: TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) IMMEDIATELY HEADING (three digits) TO AVOID [UNIDENTIFIED] TRAFFIC (bearing by clock-reference and distance).
345.u:
For avoiding action
Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

346.s: TURN LEFT (or RIGHT) (number of degrees) DEGREES IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID [UNIDENTIFIED] TRAFFIC AT (bearing by clock-reference and distance).
346.u:
For avoiding action
Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

t.t: LGL123 turn left six zero degrees immediately to avoid traffic at your one o’clock,   six miles.

t.t: LGL123 if you read squawk ident.

351.s: (manoeuvre, SQUAWK or IDENT) OBSERVED. POSITION (position of aircraft). [(instructions)].
351.u: Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

t.t: LGL123 right turn observed. Position one two miles south of Skiro (SKI). Resume own navigation SKI.

352.u: Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

t.t: LGL123 radar control terminated due to leaving radar coverage.

353.s: WILL SHORTLY LOSE IDENTIFICATION (appropriate instructions or information).
353.u: Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

354.u: Applicable when an ATS surveillance system is used in the provision of ATS

t.t: LGL123 ADS-B out of service.

428.u: To instruct the setting of the transponder

t.t: LGL123 squawk seven one three two.

429.u:
Pilot answers: Resetting
To request the pilot to reselect the assigned mode and code

t.t: LGL123 reset squawk Charlie four one six two.

430.s: RE-ENTER [ADS-B or MODE S] AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION.
430.u: To request reselection of aircraft identification

t.t: LGL123 re enter Mode S aircraft identification.

431.u:
Pilot answers: SQUAWKING (code).
To request the pilot to confirm the code selected on the aircraft's transponder

t.t: LGL123 confirm squawk three five four six.

432.u: To request the operation of the ident feature

t.t: LGL123 squawk ident.

433.u: To request the operation of the ident feature

t.t: Blue123 squawk low.

434.u: To request the operation of the ident feature

t.t: Blue123 squawk normal.

435.u: To request the operation of the ident feature

t.t: LGL123 transmit ADS-B IDENT.

436.u: To request temporary suspension of transponder operation

t.t: LGL123 squawk standby.
LGL123 squawk mayday. Code seven-seven-zero-zero.

438.u:
To request termination of transponder and/or ADS-B transmitter operation
Note.— Independent operations of Mode S transponder and ADS-B may not be possible in all aircraft (e.g. where ADS-B is solely provided by 1 090 MHz extended squitter emitted from the transponder). In such cases, aircraft may not be able to comply with ATC instructions related to ADS-B operation.

t.t: Blue123 stop squawk.

439.u:
To request termination of transponder and/or ADS-B transmitter operation
Note.— Independent operations of Mode S transponder and ADS-B may not be possible in all aircraft (e.g. where ADS-B is solely provided by 1 090 MHz extended squitter emitted from the transponder). In such cases, aircraft may not be able to comply with ATC instructions related to ADS-B operation.

t.t: LGL123 stop ADS-B transmission.

440.u: To request transmission of pressure altitude

t.t: LGL 123 squawk Charlie.

441.u: To request transmission of pressure altitude

t.t: LGL123 transmit ADS-B altitude.

442.u: To request pressure setting check and confirmation of level

t.t: LGL123 check altimeter setting and confirm level one six zero.

443.u:
To request termination of pressure altitude transmission because of faulty operation.
Note.— Independent operations of Mode S transponder and ADS-B may not be possible in all aircraft (e.g. where ADS-B is solely provided by 1 090 MHz extended squitter emitted from the transponder). In such cases, aircraft may not be able to comply with ATC instructions related to ADS-B operation.

t.t: LGL123 stop squawk Charlie wrong indication.

444.s: STOP ADS-B ALTITUDE TRANSMISSION [(WRONG INDICATION, or reason)].
444.u:
To request termination of pressure altitude transmission because of faulty operation.
Note.— Independent operations of Mode S transponder and ADS-B may not be possible in all aircraft (e.g. where ADS-B is solely provided by 1 090 MHz extended squitter emitted from the transponder). In such cases, aircraft may not be able to comply with ATC instructions related to ADS-B operation.

t.t: LGL123 stop ADS-B altitude transmission, wrong indication.

446.s: ADS-C (or ADS-CONTRACT) OUT OF SERVICE (appropriate information as necessary).

t.t: LGL123 ADS-C out of service.

456.u: All numbers, except those used in the transmission of altitude, cloud height, visibility and runway visual range (RVR) information, which contain whole hundreds and whole thousands, shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of hundreds or thousands followed by the word HUNDRED or THOUSAND as appropriate. Combinations of thousands and whole hundreds shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of thousands followed by the word THOUSAND followed by the number of hundreds followed by the word HUNDRED.

t.t: Visibility 1000m<br />Visibility one thousand meters

464.u:
Multiple RVR observations are always representative of the touchdown zone, midpoint zone and the roll-out/stop end zone respectively.
Where reports for the three locations are given, the indication of these locations may be omitted, provided that the reports are passed in order of touchdown zone, followed by midpoint zone and ending with the roll-out/stop end zone report. In the event that RVR information on any one position is not available this information will be included in the appropriate sequence

All numbers, except those used in the transmission of altitude, cloud height, visibility and runway visual range (RVR) information, which contain whole hundreds and whole thousands, shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of hundreds or thousands followed by the word HUNDRED or THOUSAND as appropriate. Combinations of thousands and whole hundreds shall be transmitted by pronouncing each digit in the number of thousands followed by the word THOUSAND followed by the number of hundreds followed by the word HUNDRED.

t.t: Runway visual range runway zero niner six hundred metres.

478.u: Means: “Let me know that you have received and understood this message.”

t.t: LGL123 acknowledge by moving ailerons.
Affirm, LGL123.
LGL123 start up approved.<br />

481.u:
Means: “I hereby indicate the separation between portions of the message.”
(To be used where there is no clear
distinction between the text and other portions of the message.)

t.t: BREAK

482.u: Means: “I hereby indicate the separation between messages transmitted to different aircraft in a very busy environment.”

t.t: LGL123 maintain FL310 break break AFR367 climb to FL350.
LGL123 hold position, cancel take-off, I say again, cancel take-off, vehicles blocking the runway.

484.u:
Means: “Examine a system or procedure.”
(Not to be used in any other context. No answer is normally expected.)

t.t: New York radio Swissair one one zero request SELCAL check.

485.u: Means: “Authorised to proceed under the conditions specified.”

t.t: LGL123 cleared to Oslo via Staby upper Tango three eight zero, flight planned route, FL320.

486.u: Means: “I request verification of: (clearance, instruction, action, information).”

t.t: LGL123 confirm squawk three five four six.
LGL123 contact Tampere control one two four decimal one five.
LGL 123 correct.

489.u: Means: “An error has been made in this transmission (or message indicated). The correct version is...”

t.t: LGL 123 correction, proceed direct to MIKI.
LGL123 disregard CPDLC climb clearance message, break maintain FL 260.

491.u: Means: “What is the readability of my transmission?”

t.t: LGL 123 how do you read?

492.u: Means: “I repeat for clarity or emphasis.”

t.t: LGL 123 I say again proceed direct to MIKI.

493.u: Means: “Continue in accordance with the condition(s) specified” or in its literal sense.

t.t: DCAWM Maintain VFR.
LGL123 monitor Tampere control one one eight decimal zero zero five

495.u: Means: “No” or “Permission not granted” or “That is not correct” or “Not capable”.

t.t: Negative, LGL123.

496.u:
Means: “My transmission is ended, and I expect a response from you.”
Note.— Not normally used in VHF
communications.

t.t: Over.

497.u:
Means: “This exchange of transmissions is ended and no response is expected.”
Note.— Not normally used in VHF
communications.

t.t: Out.

498.u: Means: “Repeat all, or the specified part, of this message back to me exactly as received.”

t.t: LGL123 read back clearance.

499.u: Means:  “A change has been made to your last clearance and this new clearance supersedes your previous clearance or part thereof.”

t.t: LGL123 recleared FL330.
LGL123 report flight conditions.<br />

501.u: Means: “I should like to know...” or “I wish to obtain...”

t.t: LGL123 request level change from Tampere control at time four five.

502.u:
Means: “I have received all of your last transmission.”
Note.— Under no circumstances to be used in reply to a question requiring “READ BACK” or a direct answer in the affirmative (AFFIRM) or negative (NEGATIVE).

t.t: Roger, LGL123.

503.u: Means: “Repeat all, or the following part, of your last transmission.”

t.t: LGL123 say again.
LGL123 speak slower.

505.u:
Means: “Wait and I will call you.”
Note.— The caller would normally
re-establish contact if the delay is
lengthy. STANDBY is not an approval or denial.

t.t: LGL123 standby for further instructions.

506.u:
Means: “I cannot comply with your request, instruction, or clearance.”
Note.— UNABLE is normally followed by a reason.

t.t: LGL123, if unable maintain FL210 and advise.

507.u:
Means: “I understand your message and will comply with it.”
(Abbreviation for “will comply”.)

t.t: Wilco, LGL123.

508.u:
Means: a) As a request: “Communication is difficult. Please send every word, or group of words, twice.”
b) As information: “Since communication is difficult, every word, or group of words, in this message will be sent twice.”

t.t: LGL123 words twice, I say again words twice.

509.u: Except where all VHF voice communications channels are separated by 25 kHz or more and the use of six digits as in  is not substantiated by the operational requirement determined by the appropriate authorities, the first five digits of the numerical designator should be used, except in the case of both the fifth and sixth digits being zeros, in which case only the first four digits should be used In all other cases all six digits of the numerical designator should be used to identify the transmitting channel in VHF radiotelephony communications, except in the case of both the fifth and sixth digits being zeros, in which case only the first four digits should be used.

t.t: 118.005<br />ONE ONE EIGHT DECIMAL ZERO ZERO FIVE

510.u: Except where all VHF voice communications channels are separated by 25 kHz or more and the use of six digits as in  is not substantiated by the operational requirement determined by the appropriate authorities, the first five digits of the numerical designator should be used, except in the case of both the fifth and sixth digits being zeros, in which case only the first four digits should be used In all other cases all six digits of the numerical designator should be used to identify the transmitting channel in VHF radiotelephony communications, except in the case of both the fifth and sixth digits being zeros, in which case only the first four digits should be used.

t.t: 118.000<br />ONE ONE EIGHT DECIMAL ZERO

511.u:
In addition to being preceded by the radiotelephony distress signal MAYDAY, preferably spoken three times, the distress message to be sent by an aircraft in distress shall:
a) be on the air-ground frequency in use at the time.
b) consist of as many as possible of the following elements spoken distinctly and, if possible, in the following order:
1) name of the station addressed (time and circumstances permitting).
2) the identification of the aircraft.
3) the nature of the distress condition.
4) intention of the person in command.
5) present position, level (i.e. flight level, altitude, etc., as appropriate) and heading.

t.t: LGL123, mayday, mayday, mayday, fire onboard.
Mayday, mayday, mayday, LGL123  fire onboard.

512.s: Pan Pan, Pan Pan, Pan Pan, reason
512.u:
In addition to being preceded by the radiotelephony urgency signal PAN PAN, preferably spoken three times and each word of the group pronounced as the French word “panne”, the urgency message to be sent by an aircraft reporting an urgency condition shall:
a) be on the air-ground frequency in use at the time.
b) consist of as many as required of the following elements spoken distinctly and, if possible, in the following order:
1) the name of the station addressed.
2) the identification of the aircraft.
3) the nature of the urgency condition.
4) the intention of the person in command.
5) present position, level (i.e. flight level, altitude, etc., as appropriate) and heading.
6) any other useful information.

t.t: LGL123, pan pan, pan pan, pan pan, sick person onboard, suspected heart attack.
Pan pan, pan pan, pan pan, LGL123, sick person onboard, suspected heart attack.
DLH123, proceed OSN, DOM, NOR.

514.s: CLIMB (or DESCENT) (level) IMMEDIATELY TO AVOID [UNIDENTIFIED] TRAFFIC AT (bearing by clock-reference and distance)
514.u: To issue an avoiding action to aircraft.

t.t: BAW225, descend FL320 immediately to avoid traffic at 11 o'clock 9 miles, unknown, crossing from left to right, inidcating FL330 unverified.

515.s: CLIMB [DESCEND] FL(nnn), REACH [PASS] FL(nnn) WITHIN (n) MINUTES
515.u: Use of RoC/RoD to ensure: correct exit conditions amd/or separation on opposite/crossing/same trackswhere the level change is relatively small vertical distance which may not be sufficient for the aircraft to establish a steady vertical speed

t.t: LOT953, climb FL350, pass FL310 within 2 minutes.

516.s: MAINTAIN (INCREASE or REDUCE) SPEED (number) KNOTS [OR GREATER (or OR LESS)]

t.t: KLM131, increase speed 290 knots or greater.

517.u: Conflict warning passed from CC to EC.

RIANS, approval request RKN, KLM225, FL270
RIANS, revision GMH, DLH87B, FL330
RIANS, expedite clearence BASUM, IBE220, climbing FL350, BASUM FL330 or above

521.s: REQUEST USE OF AIRSPACE, (position / area), c/s, (details)

RIANS, request release for turn, ARNEM, ACA884
RIANS, Handover, 10NM East of RKN, KLM234, squawk 1234, FL360

t.t: RIANS, transfer of identification 10NM North of GMH, DLH443
